text: hi everyone today I will be cooking a
very simple soup that we normally cook
as part of a daily Vietnamese meal is
called can Vidal or winter melon soup
with shrimps let's begin recipes to
prepare the shrimps use a pair of
scissors to trim off the tip of the head
and some of the front legs then peel off
the shell
you just have to peel the upper part of
the shrimp then just hold and press the
tail and the lower part of the shell
will just lie off
normally I don't peel the shrimps just
use everything including the skin in the
head the shell has a lot of calcium and
it's also add more sweetness to the soup
then I know many of you will say Helen
don't you peel off the shell so today I
peel and devein the shrimp just like
what they do in restaurants in a mortar
and pestle after shrooms one shallot a
quarter teaspoon absorbed and powdered
slightly then I have a quarter teaspoon
of pepper and a teaspoon of fish sauce
if you want to save cost you can just
use four to five shrimps with shell to
cook one pot of soup this is V tau or
winter melon or white god it's a very
popular vegetables in South Asia but
could be difficult to find in the West
if you can't fight winter melon you can
use shell T or - o shoe or opals wash
table or even karate or cool shoe hell
winter melon is very expensive in
Germany so I'm really glad that now I
can try winter melon soup at a very low
price just peel and cut into 2-inch
pieces
remove the soft part in the center with
the C's you want to trim off the edges
so that when you slice it a slice of
winter melon will not have a shaft color
slice into a thickness of about 1/6 of
an inch in a saucepan add about 2
teaspoons of vegetable oil and fry some
of the shallots until fragrant
then add the shrimps and stir fry on
high heat until they turn orange then
add 1 liter or 4 cups of hot water
adding hot water will help reduce the
fishy smell of the shrimp and also have
this to cook faster season the soup to
your taste I add half a teaspoon of salt
and a teaspoon of chicken stock which is
optional now you can have a taste and I
trust the seasonings to your preference
then add the winter melon and bring the
soup to a boil again occasionally skim
off the form after stir frying the
orange part in the head of the shrimp
give our soup a very nice color winter
melon cooks very fast so as soon as the
soup voice again just turn off the heat
the remaining heat will cook it further
and until you serve they will turn
translucent which is just right if you
use kohlrabi or shallow tea you can cook
a little longer transfer to a large bowl
and garnish with some chopped spring
onion or cilantro a bowl of hot soup or
can is a must-have for any Vietnamese
meal we will serve it alongside with
other side dishes with hot steamed rice
normally I will eat half about a price
with other side dishes and when I have
half a bowl of rice left
I will ladle the soup into the bowl and
finish it mmm it tastes really great
just as amazing food photos that you
have uploaded on Instagram Google+ and
Facebook with hash tag Helen recipes I'm
really surprised that many of you really
invest a lot of time and money in buying
the special tools to make special dishes
like small pancakes Monica thank you so
much for sharing your food with us and I
look forward to seeing more mean why
don't forget to click like and subscribe
to my channel for more delicious
Vietnamese food thank you for watching
bye
